page.title: 16 Mammals of the area cont.
page.content: Water voles are the largest voles to be found in this country.Often mistakenly called water rats,they are harmless and feed on willow and grass along the sides of slow running rivers. The grey squirrel is an unpopular animal with foresters.Introduced from America it soon spread throughout the country and is a great pest eating the bark and shoots off saplings.Rabbits are also widespread pests.This attractive animal lived in warrens until the outbreak of myxomatosis.Since then they have lived mainly under bramble thickets.A relative of the rabbit is the brown hare.This is a solitary animal which is very attractive and has longer ears and legs than the rabbit.Two closely related killers are the stoat and the weasel which are also found in this area.
